fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom
Class SecureTransport

Object
  SecureTransport

public class SecureTransport
extends Object

An instance of SecureTransport must be specified when defining a peer AE or when listening for incoming associations if secure transport with SSL or TLS is sought.

The DICOM standard (PS 3.15) defines 2 profiles that DICOM implementations may choose to conform to. The basic TLS profile mandates the use of the TLS protocole (over SSL) and of the cipher suite TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA. The AES TLS profile mandates the use of the TLS protocole and the cipher suites TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA (prefered) or TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA (fallback). As of Java 1.5.0, the "SunJCE" JCE provider that comes with Java does not support TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA. It does support SSL_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA and, since Java 1.4.2, TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA. In order to build an application that conforms to one of the standard DICOM TLS profile, another JCE provider must then be installed in the JVM to add support for TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA.

Either the requestor, the acceptor, or both must be authentified using a certificate. The certificates used for key exchanges and for validation may be stored in keystore files, or a custom SSLContext may be set using setSSLContext. If the certificates are stored in keystore files, the properties javax.net.ssl.keyStore, javax.net.ssl.keyStorePassword, javax.net.ssl.trustStore and javax.net.ssl.trustStorePassword may be used to point to these files.

Predefined instances of SecureTransport are defined corresponding to the DICOM profiles and to the Java default configuration, with different authentification strategies. Custom instances can also be created to specify a precise choice of protocol (TLSv1 or SSLv3), cipher suites and authentification strategy.

Constructor Detail

SecureTransport

public SecureTransport(String[] protocols,
                       String[] cipherSuites,
                       boolean clientIsRequestor,
                       int clientAuth)
Create a new custom SecureTransport.

Parameters:
protocols - The protocols accepted on the associations using this SecureTransport, usually TLSv1, SSLv3 or both. If null, the default protocols defined by the Java socket factories are used.
cipherSuites - The standard names of the cipher suites accepted on the associations using this SecureTransport. If null, the default cipher suites defined by the Java socket factories are used.
clientIsRequestor - Normally set to true to indicate that the TLS/SSL client is the application requesting the association (the TCP client). This option must have the same value in the requestor and the acceptor.
clientAuth - One of CLIENTAUTH_NONE, CLIENTAUTH_REQUEST and CLIENTAUTH_NEED.
